data.title: A great place for the family
data.text: Had a nice breakfast there.  If you leave hungry, it's your own fault.  Very friendly and efficient servers.

data.title: Lunch
data.text:
This is an ok joint. Pulled up and it was busy which is always a good sign. Staff and service was excellent. And I appreciate the fact that they have the old fashioned pour sugar dispensers as opposed to those darn packets. Portions were very generous. Food was ok. I had chicken noodle soup, kiddos had mac and cheese and grams had the hot meatloaf. 

All in all I might give this place another shot just to make sure it wasn't an off day but wouldn't come back again based on the food today. 

Although I might come back for the coffee and the real sugar dispenser.

data.title: Very good place for a breakfast.
data.text:
Well... Sort of. This time we were there for breakfast but I ended up ordering a hamburger. I have been here before and ordered something traditionally breakfast but this time I wanted something else. 

Anyhoo, let's break it down.

Ambiance: The Sunrise Cafe is located within downtown Meridian, so you have the opportunity to take a quaint walk before or after eating. Everywhere within the restaurant is ground level, so wheelchairs are safe here. The distance between seats are decently spacious, so getting around is easy. During warmer weather seating may be available outside, which is nice for those who like to dine al fresco. 

Service: Our server was very polite and never left us waiting on anything. Small friendly talk was welcome and made the moment go by faster. Thanks Tina.

Food: On this occasion I ordered the Western Burger. The burger was cooked correctly as I ordered; medium-rare and the flavor was very good. It doesn't deserve a wow, but the burger had very good flavor.

data.title: BEST BREAKFAST EVER
data.text: This place is sooo good its hard to get into.  They do serve fast.  GREAT food!  Great Staff!!  GREAT Customer Service!!

data.title: Grease fix for life in a single meal.
data.text: If soggy fries dripping in grease are you thing, this is the place for you. Wish I could say something good as this place has been here for 30-40 years, but think it's become an institution because it was the only place in town for several years and it at least used to be open after the bars closed.

data.title: An excellent breakfast
data.text:
I've eaten breakfast at the Sunrise Cafe in Meridian on two different occasions and my experience
has always been excellent.  The food is very good and the service is excellent.  The place is busy but 
clean and the management and waiters are very helpful and attentive. The location is also nice as there is 
a little park across the street and the view from the windows is great.  I look forward to eating there 
again the next time i'm in Meridian.

data.title: For the money go to Egg Factory or Mojos
data.text: You're looking at an average of 10 bucks a plate for breakfast and the quality is just not there. Most at our table liked it well enough but could get better down the road. Our food came our very fast but too fast. Hash browns were under done and my eggs were slimy. I ordered the country platter which boasted chunks of chicken fried steak, onions and hash browns covered in sausage gravy. The onions were raw and it was completely covered. I literally had mouthfuls that were just gravy and strong raw onion chunks. Talk about heart burn! The employees were friendly and it does have that traditional cafe feel which is nice.

data.title: Good food at Great Price
data.text: Step back in time a bit, but the food is very good and at a great price.  Efficient, friendly service!

data.title: A nice Mom and Pop type of place
data.text: A nice Mom and Pop type of place.  Basic, good breakfast and lunch food.  Nothing fancy, but the people are nice.

data.title: Aware at place for early meet ups
data.text: The lodge brothers like to meet here sometimes for breakfast when we need to get together early.  The food is really good and the price is right.  It's a quiet locally owned downtown diner that always satisfies.

data.title: Bland
data.text:
First time eating at Sunrise Cafe, heard so many great things about this place, I was excited to go there. 

I ordered the French dip and fresh cut fries (you pay extra for those). I was quite disappointed when the food was served. The French dip had no flavor and the au jus that came with it was very watered down and had no flavor as well. The fries were OK, but not what I had expected. They supposedly are hand cut, potato fries, but tasted like any other frozen fries out of the bag. An Arby's French dip is much better and at least you can taste it.

I've heard breakfast is their specialty. So maybe, if I go there again, I will visit during breakfast and see if the food is better.

The waitress was not very personable or friendly. Waters would never refilled.

data.title: Comfort food at its best
data.text: My fave place for breakfast food anytime of the day.  A staple in my family's dining out go to places.  Try the chicken fried steak or the reuben, you won't be disappointed.

data.title: Wonderful Place to meet in Meridian
data.text: Had a wonderful lunch there last week with a very dear friend. The staff is always welcoming and the food is outstanding. Located right in downtown area very nice refurbished area of town.

data.title: Fantastic Breakfast!
data.text: They really do breakfast right! Love visiting on the weekends for a little change of pace. And the service is really good.  Be prepared of a wait during peak hours.

data.title: It's an instituttion
data.text: Breakfast is, by definition, a really easy thing to make, according to my wife.  I disagree.  I think making hash browns perfectly is a skill.  It also takes a lot of skill to make it all come out at the same time.  To do all that while also making food that tastes really good is a neat trick as well.  They make a serious breakfast there.  There are kids and it's noisy and the waitress might call you "Hon" but you get to enjoy it among normal folks in the #1 ranked small city (65,000+) in the USA.  This is no small thing.  This place has managed to maintain it's identity but not rest on it's laurels.

data.title: Disappointing
data.text: Stopped by for a late breakfast.  Had cinnamon roll and bowl of fruit.  The service was slow, coffee okay, the fruit was terrible and found a piece of onion at bottom of fruit bowl.  Ate about half the fruit, told the waitress, she didn't care.  Stopped by the restroom before i left, it was dirty and there was no soap, where are the employees washing their hands, or are they?

data.title: Had the breakfast special: two halves french toast (cinnamon), hash browns, and bacon.
data.text: Very responsive service. French toast was unique with the cinnamon.  Very much like it!  Fresh hash browns and bacon.  Very good!

data.title: Good Food. Super Busy on Weekends.
data.text:
I have mixed feelings about the Sunrise Cafe. It is a classic little diner that is not fancy. Everything about it is plain and simple and the food is pretty good. 

The food is what you would expect to get at an old school diner. You can always get a very good breakfast at the Sunrise Cafe. The corned beef hash is very good and the portion sizes are quite large.

Wait staff are friendly but usually very busy. This place is usually packed, especially for breakfast, and you may have to wait for a table (no reservations and seat yourself,) especially on weekends. 

I would give the Sunrise Cafe a "very good" rating if they gave the place a super good cleaning and replaced most of the old and dated (and pretty dusty) decor.

data.title: Good eats
data.text: I have been eating here for years. You can't beat the service or the food. They have great breakfast specials. If what you want is not the special, no worries, It is all at a reasonable price.

data.title: Great food and Staff
data.text: We had breakfast here three times because we liked it so much.  They have awesome waitresses and the food was fresh and good.  I really liked their ice coffee.  I'm not much into them, but my granddaughter told me how good they were.  We had a large group on the weekend and they really worked at accommodating us.
